N5L1VQuiz.question: polite equivalent of あのひと
polite equivalent of なんさい
Pleased to meet you.
N5L1VQuiz.kanji_question: 「どうぞ」よろしく「お願いします」。
N5L1VQuiz.answer: 「どうぞ」よろしく「おねがいします」。

N5L2VQuiz.question: Oh? What! (used when hearing something unexpected)
Thank you [very much].
N5L2VQuiz.answer: 「どうも」ありがとう「ございます」。

N5L2VQuiz.question: Oh! (used when becoming aware of something)
I hope for your kind assistance hereafter.
N5L2VQuiz.kanji_question: これからお世話になります。
N5L2VQuiz.answer: これからおせわになります。

N5L2VQuiz.question: Pleased to meet you, too. (response to「どうぞ」よろしく「おねがいします」。)
N5L2VQuiz.answer: こちらこそ「どうぞ」よろしく「おねがいします」。

N5L3VQuiz.question: that way, that place near you
that way, that place over there
Welcome./May I help you? (a greeting to a customer or guest entering a shop, etc.)

N5L4VQuiz.question: take a rest, take a holiday
rest, a holiday, a day off
That's tough, isn't it? (used when expressing sympathy)

N5L5VQuiz.question: which day of the month, how many days
Thank you very much.
N5L5VQuiz.answer: 「どうも」ありがとうございました。

N5L6VQuiz.question: a little while, a little bit

N5L7VQuiz.question: How nice of you to come.
Do come in.
N5L7VQuiz.kanji_question: どうぞお上がりください。
N5L7VQuiz.answer: どうぞおあがりください。

N5L7VQuiz.question: Won't you have ~?/Would you like to have ~?
That was delicious. (said after eating or drinking)

N5L8VQuiz.question: Won't you have another cup of ~?
N5L8VQuiz.answer: ～、もういっぱいいかがですか。

N5L8VQuiz.question: It's almost time to leave now.
N5L8VQuiz.answer: そろそろしつれいします。

N5L8VQuiz.question: Please come again.
N5L8VQuiz.answer: またいらっしゃってください。

N5L9VQuiz.question: Won't you join me (us)?
N5L9VQuiz.answer: いっしょにいかがですか。

N5L9VQuiz.question: Please ask me again some other time.
N5L9VQuiz.kanji_question: また今度お願いします。
N5L9VQuiz.answer: またこんどおねがいします。

N5L10VQuiz.question: a fixed place to catch taxis, trains, etc.

N5L11VQuiz.question: See you later./So long. (said by who is sending someone off)
See you later./So long. (said by who is going out)
airmail
N5L11VQuiz.answer: こうくうびん（エアメール）

N5L12VQuiz.question: Wow! Look at all those people!
N5L12VQuiz.answer: わあ、すごいひとですね。

N5L13VQuiz.question: bowl of rice topped with beef
Please wait [a moment].
N5L13VQuiz.answer: 「しょうしょう」おまちください。

N5L14VQuiz.question: how to read, way of reading
right (used when encouraging some course of action)
Turn to the right at the signal.
N5L14VQuiz.kanji_question: 信号を右へ曲がってください。
N5L14VQuiz.answer: しんごうをみぎへまがってください。

N5L14VQuiz.question: I'd like to pay with this.
N5L14VQuiz.answer: これでおねがいします。

N5L16VQuiz.question: tour, visit a place to study it
which one (of three or more things)
[No,] I still have a long way to go.

N5L17VQuiz.question: two or three ~ (where ~ is a counter suffix)

N5L18VQuiz.question: That interesting, isn't it?
N5L18VQuiz.answer: それはおもしろいですね。

N5L20VQuiz.question: Mr. (an informal equivalent of ～さん used to address people of equal or lower status)
yes (an informal equivalent of はい)
no (an informal equivalent of いいえ)
this way, that place over there
I'm full.
N5L20VQuiz.answer: おなかがいっぱいです。

N5L21VQuiz.question: quit or retire from, stop, give up
talk, speech, what, one says, story
It's been a long time since we last met.
I have to get home now.
heroine of the old Japanese folk tale 'Taketori Monogatari'

N5L22VQuiz.question: Congratulations. (used on birthdays, at weddings, New Year's Day, etc.)
N5L22VQuiz.answer: おめでとう「ございます」。

N5L25VQuiz.question: Thank you for everything you've done for me.
N5L25VQuiz.kanji_question: 「いろいろ」お世話になりました。
N5L25VQuiz.answer: 「いろいろ」おせわになりました。
